poem:
Title: "Under the Bowels of Broiling Air"

Michigan moans, a kettle under sun's tyranny,
Ohio sighs and sweat trails curve in Pennsylvania.
A fierce beast, the heatwave prowls, ravenous 
across the vast expanse of our tender land.
Warnings chime in empty corridors, echoing fears,
Of a bruising weight of heat, a burdensome dome.
Humanity flinches, under this stark, merciless glare 
of nature's blatant apathy and fiery kerb.
